NewWords.Sentence: e.g. They showed little mercy to the enemies.

NewWords.WordPhrase: a. suffering from a serious physical or mental disability 有生理缺陷的，残疾的
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. Though handicapped by poor health, he persisted in working at the research project.

NewWords.WordPhrase: for the rest of a person's life 终生
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. As a result of the accident, he was disabled for life.

NewWords.WordPhrase: return an injury 报仇，报复   revenge n. 报仇，报复
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. They swore to take their revenge on the kidnappers.
e.g. I won't go until I'm good and ready.

NewWords.WordPhrase: be decided by; need the support of (sb. or sth.) 取决于；依靠
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. This area depends on the mining industry.

NewWords.WordPhrase: v. gather in or up as if with a scoop; take up or out with a scoop 掬起；用勺舀
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. She scooped flour out of the bag.

NewWords.WordPhrase: (cause sth. to) become completely covered or blocked with ice （使）结冰；（使）冻结
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. The window has frozen up and I can't open it.

NewWords.WordPhrase: v. go away; push roughly 走开；乱推，挤
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. You aren't wanted here, so shove off!

NewWords.WordPhrase: a. uncomfortably and unnaturally aware of oneself and one's actions 忸怩的，不自然的
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. She is self-conscious about her appearance.

NewWords.WordPhrase: vt. hit (sb.) hard, esp. with the fist （用拳头）重击
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. He felt as if he had been slugged by a piece of lead pipe.

NewWords.WordPhrase: v. push one's thumb into the eye of; remove (sth.) from a hole using a pointed object or one's fingers 用拇指挖出…的眼睛；挖，掘
heap or pile in a bank; rise in or form a bank 将…堆积起来；聚集成堆
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. They banked up the logs.
e.g. Will they let the hostages go?

NewWords.WordPhrase: v. strike or beat forcibly with the bottom of the foot; bring down (the foot) forcibly 重踩，重踏；跺（脚）
vt. tap gently, usu. with the hand flat 轻拍，轻打
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. I patted him on the shoulder.

NewWords.WordPhrase: stop (sth.) from happening any more; abolish 制止， 终止；废止
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. She stood up and put a stop to all these rumors.

NewWords.WordPhrase: a. having or resulting from luck 侥幸的；幸运的
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. I was lucky that I met you here.

NewWords.WordPhrase: a., ad.  drifting; aimless 漂浮着（的）；漫无目的地（的）
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. They were rescued after three days adrift on the sea.
